abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, sustainability is likely, and the
            institutional development impact is substantial. Lessons
            emphasize that the cooperative planning, and implementation
            of the project - based on mutual trust between the Bank, and
            Borrower - allowed the transfer of new ideas, and approaches
            to project planning, and management, as well as for
            supporting infrastructure investments. This was conducive to
            a shift from a "reactive", to a
            "proactive" approach, in the development of the
            strategic plan for the Haapsalu Veevark, and the management
            plan for the Matsalu State nature reserve. Additionally, the
            integration of targeted infrastructure investments (focused
            primarily on water, and wastewater services improvement in
            urban areas), but with broader environmental goals,
            successfully achieved the selected environmental management
            activities in adjacent coastal areas, which allowed
            collection, treatment, and disposal of wastewaters to be
            linked with an improved coastal management, and,
            strengthened as well, the management of protected areas. The
            suitability of the participatory approach during the initial
            project implementation, supported by the environmental
            management component, not only increased ownership among
            local communities, and stakeholders in the management of
            protected areas, but the skills gained through these
            participatory activities, can be widely applied in
            environmental development measures. Finally, the project
            demonstrated the beneficial aspects of adjusting project
            objectives, to comply with international environmental
            agreements, namely the Helsinki Convention on Protection of
            Baltic Marine Environment, the Ramsar Convention, and,
            further enhanced the accession process to the European Union.
